greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular region of A230415, a triangular table read by rows: T(n, k) tells in how many digit positions the factorial base representations (A007623) of n and k differ, where (n, k) = (0,0), (1,0), (1,1), (2,0), (2,1), (2,2), ..., n >= 0 and (0 <= k <= n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: a(n) = A230415bi(A003056(n),A002262(n)). [As a sequence, this is obtained by taking a subsection from array A230415.]
For n >= 1, T(n,n-1) = A055881(n) [the last nonzero column].
example: Please see A230415 for examples how the terms are computed.
program: (define (A230415bi x y) (let loop ((x x) (y y) (i 2) (d 0)) (cond ((and (zero? x) (zero? y)) d) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ x i)) (floor->exact (/ y i)) (+ i 1) (+ d (if (= (modulo x i) (modulo y i)) 0 1)))))))
xref: This is a lower, or equivalently, an upper triangular subregion of symmetric square array A230415.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 10 2013
